image.altText: Composite image of Morgan Smithies (left) and Hudson Young (right) running the ball for the Canberra Raiders in NRL games.

props.synopsis: Canberra Raiders pair Hudson Young and Morgan Smithies apologise for an incident in a Las Vegas hotel that saw the two "really good mates" briefly kicked out of the building.

title.children: Raiders pair Young and Smithies apologise for Las Vegas 'scuffle'

image.altText: A woman is approached by an airport worker as she walks through the security area of the airport.

props.synopsis: A magistrate describes a woman's behaviour as "extremely bizarre" as he sentences her for evading security staff and running out onto the tarmac at Canberra Airport in 2023.

title.children: 'Extremely bizarre': Woman fined for running onto Canberra Airport tarmac

image.altText: A military service Belgian shepherd sits on the grass in front of the Australian War Memorial.

props.synopsis: A Belgian shepherd who went from pound puppy to decorated combat veteran has been honoured with a new award for distinguished military service at the Australian War Memorial.

title.children: 'The $8 dog' wins prestigious award for military service

image.altText: A school sign on the exterior of a large modern building.

props.synopsis: Some Brindabella Christian College staff have not been paid their salaries on time, with the school's executive principal putting the blame on "timing challenges" related to the payment of school fees by parents.

title.children: 'I ask for your patience': Private school principal tells unpaid staff

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann appears in a Tasmanian court via phone to face allegations he stole a car in the Huon Valley, south of Hobart.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann faces Hobart court on car theft charge

image.altText: Red poppies left at a sculpture

props.synopsis: A sculpture at the Australian War Memorial representing the impact of service-related trauma on veterans and their families is providing a place for grieving and commemoration one year since being officially dedicated.

title.children: 'I miss your smile': Letters and photos left at war memorial sculpture

image.altText: Young man in bushland wearing a dark green shirt.

props.synopsis: For 13 days Hadi Nazari was lost in Kosciuszko National Park's unforgiving and untamed wilderness. This is his story of survival, told like never before.

title.children: 'Every negligence accumulated': Hadi Nazari on why he got lost in Kosciuszko

image.altText: a man in a green shirt crosses his arms at a table

props.synopsis: Canberra is widely considered 'the most renter-friendly' city, but amid constant legislative changes in favour of tenants, that title may be coming at a cost to landlords, with investors leaving the ACT.

title.children: Investors leaving Australia's 'most renter-friendly' city

image.altText: damaged gravestones

props.synopsis: The 180-year-old Queanbeyan Riverside Cemetery is home to its fair share of ghost stories, urban myths and legends, but locals fear for its future due to a lack of maintenance and vandalism.

title.children: Historical cemetery known for floating coffins and ghost stories in grave danger

image.altText: Former president Donald Trump is surrounded by army cadets while watching a football game.

props.synopsis: Experts say Australia matters less to Trump than it did to Biden which has consequences for vital intelligence-sharing alliance Five Eyes as well as the AUKUS deal.

title.children: Australia's perceived value to the US changes under Trump

image.altText: Proxy twins visit Queensland hospital

props.synopsis: Last year saw an increase in the number of organ donors, but as donors age and families refuse permission, fewer Australians are receiving life-saving donations.

title.children: Twin boys get life-saving organ transplants weeks apart

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: With land cheaper in the outer suburbs, families are opting to live in neighbourhoods that often lack basic health, education, retail and transport services. How long does it take for people to comfortably call these places home?

title.children: 'Urban sprawl is failing': Fighting the tyranny of distance in Australia's outer suburbs

image.altText: Dr Jay Shoemaker photographed in medical consulting room.

props.synopsis: Two siblings running a clinic in Tasmania, which has the country's worst bulk-billing rate, say the new Medicare model proposed by Labor isn't viable at their practice for standard adult appointments.

title.children: New bulk-billing funding won't sway this GP clinic

image.altText: A Virgin plane flying in the sky in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Airservices Australia representatives tell a parliamentary hearing that almost 50 flights were forced to divert after China signalled it was conducting the hazardous drills in busy international airspace.

title.children: Chinese 'live fire' military exercise forced nearly 50 flight diversions

image.altText: Unidentified woman receives a mammogram.

props.synopsis: Australian scientists said an aging population, alcohol consumption and low physical activity could all be contributing to the country's high breast cancer rate.

title.children: Australians record highest breast cancer diagnosis rate in the world

image.altText: Trump shakes hands with French President Emmanuel Macron at the White House

props.synopsis: The French president's visit to Washington comes amid alarm in Europe over Mr Trump's hardening stance toward Ukraine.

title.children: After Trump talks, Macron says 'peace mustn't mean surrender of Ukraine'

image.altText: Flood plume from Burdekin River captured on Feb 18 Courtesy Copernicus Sentinel 2

props.synopsis: Satellite imagery reveals huge amounts of floodwater heading into the ocean and towards parts of the Great Barrier Reef ahead of more potential severe weather.

title.children: Satellite photos show flood run-off flowing towards parts of Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: man with tower in bakground

props.synopsis: Mobile voice and SMS connectivity would be extended across Australia under a Labor election pledge to update Australia's universal service obligation.

title.children: Labor pledges to expand voice and SMS coverage across Australia

image.altText: A black and white photo of Roberta Black on the red carpet of the Grammy Awards.

props.synopsis: Flack shot to fame in the 1970s for her hit records 'The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face' and 'Killing Me Softly With His Song'.

title.children: Grammy Award-winning singer Roberta Flack dies aged 88

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Two nuns bow their heads.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis was admitted to hospital in Rome on February 14 with breathing difficulties and his clinical picture has been described as "complex" and "critical".

title.children: Public prayers for Pope after 'slight improvement', prognosis 'not decided'

image.altText: Cairns watch house

props.synopsis: A 12-year-old boy with a disability was allegedly tormented by an older child in a Queensland watch house for more than an hour, despite the area being covered by CCTV.

title.children: Teen charged over alleged assault of disabled boy in police watch house

image.altText: Sun rising over Mars taken from orbiting spacecraft.

props.synopsis: Strange, tilted geological formations spotted on Mars may be ancient beaches on the shore of a huge ocean, data from China's Zhurong rover suggests.

title.children: Red planet or blue? Evidence of 'ancient coastline' found on Mars

image.altText: Woman in red scarf and black hijab stands in a well decorated room with green walls, green and gold cushions, carpet, curtains.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says its soldiers fired into the home in a small village near the city of Jenin because they believed Palestinian militants were inside. Instead, the gunfire left a young mother covered in her only child's blood.

title.children: Mum says 'world should do something' as 2yo dies in Israeli strike

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: Wall Street has had a bad week and overnight provided a mixed lead to our share market. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Stock market quivers after Wall Street's bad week

image.altText: An empty market shed.

props.synopsis: Fruit and vegetable traders at Melbourne's famous Queen Victoria Market are accusing the City of Melbourne of financial mismanagement and say they are paying unfair costs.

title.children: Queen Victoria Market traders strike for first time in history

image.altText: A sketch of an old bald man wearing thin glasses and a brown jacket

props.synopsis: Joel Le Scouarnec faces charges of aggravated rape and sexual assault against hundreds of victims, most of them children at the time of the alleged offence. WARNING: This story contains distressing details.

title.children: Ex-surgeon accused of assaulting 299 patients goes on trial in France

image.altText: Jack Ginnivan, Nick Watson and Connor Macdonald sit on the fence to celebrate with Hawks fans

props.synopsis: Hawthorn was one of the stories of 2024, winning admirers and driving opponents crazy in equal measure. Now in 2025, the Hawks have an oversized target on their backs.

title.children: The hunted and hated Hawks are ready to take on the world

image.altText: People are seen swimming in North Sydney Olympic Pool in Sydney

props.synopsis: The six councils says the rate increases are needed for them to remain financially sustainable and keep delivering important services.

title.children: Six NSW councils try to jack up property costs for homeowners

image.altText: A woman holds a pair of baby shoes behind her back

props.synopsis: Funding for the group, which supports people going through miscarriage, stillbirth and baby and child death, had been set to run out on June 30.

title.children: PM approves Red Nose funding that was rejected by 'some bureaucratic decision'

props.synopsis: The Prime Minister has been called out for not doing enough to protect Australians from race-based violence as he faced voters in a special live Q+A.

title.children: 'Your family should feel safe here': PM confronts racism concern

image.altText: Sandstone gates of the Bathurst prison.

props.synopsis: A NSW jail that has been operating continuously for more than 130 years should be partially closed, according to a new report by the state's prison inspector.

title.children: Prison inspector calls to close 'dark, dilapidated' cells built in 1880s

image.altText: Kelsi Cabral holding her newborn son, sitting next to her husband and toddler

props.synopsis: Hyperemesis gravidarum — severe nausea and vomiting while pregnant — meant Kelsi was bedridden for most of her pregnancy, and unable to care for her toddler.

title.children: 'I was hospitalised 15 times': Parenting with hyperemesis gravidarum
